title: Nonideal components - currents in circuits X Y Z

content.question: The figure shows three circuits, Circuit <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>, Circuit <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>, and Circuit <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math>. There is a nonideal battery in Circuit <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> and a nonideal voltmeter in Circuit <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math>. The circuitsâ€™ batteries all have the same <math alttext="e m f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>emf</mi></math>, and the resistors all have the same resistance. Which of the following correctly ranks the currents <math alttext="I sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></msub></math>, <math alttext="I sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></msub></math>, and <math alttext="I sub Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></msub></math> produced by the batteries in circuits <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>, <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>, and <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math>, respectively?

choices.label: <math alttext="I sub X is greater than I sub Y, which is greater than I sub Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="I sub X is greater than I sub Z, which is greater than I sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="I sub Z is greater than I sub X, which is greater than I sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="I sub Z is greater than I sub Y, which is greater than I sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="I sub Z is greater than I sub X, which is greater than I sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
